required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b Open-Label Study of PTR-01 in Recessive Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa (RDEB) Patients Previously Treated With PTR-01 in Study PTR-01-002

collaborator.agency: Phoenix Tissue Repair, a BridgeBio company

brief_summary.textblock: A sub-set of patients who participated in PTR-01-002 will be enrolled in an open-label study, if they meet the study eligibility criteria.

detailed_description.textblock:
Protocol PTR-01-003 is a 4-part Phase 2, open-label study of PTR-01 in patients who satisfactorily completed study PTR-01-002 and meet current enrollment criteria.
In Part 1, patients will be monitored monthly for up to 2 months with patient-reported and Investigator assessments. In Part 2, patients will receive a dose of 3.0 mg/kg every week for a total of 4 doses. This will be followed by Part 3 in which patients will receive a dose of 3.0 mg/kg monthly for a total of 5 additional doses. At the end of each dosing period, efficacy assessments will be performed. During Part 4, patients will be evaluated at Months 1 and 3 after completion of dosing to assess the durability of wound healing and other efficacy parameters. Safety will be assessed continuously throughout the study.

primary_outcome.description: Change in a majority of target lesions of at least 2 levels using a 7-point (1-7) Global Impression of Change instrument (7 being the worst)
Safety and tolerability, as assessed by treatment-emergent adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Delivery of recombinant collagen 7 (PTR-01) to skin
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of recombinant collagen 7 (PTR-01) incorporation to skin as compared to normal human skin assessed by immunofluorescence using NC1 & NC2 antibody staining

secondary_outcome.measure: Formation of anchoring fibrils
secondary_outcome.description: Formation of new anchoring fibrils as measured by electron microscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in wound surface area
secondary_outcome.description: Wound surface area of lesions as assessed by medical photography using the Canfield RUBI 3D imaging system

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skin integrity, as assessed by suction blister time
secondary_outcome.description: Change in skin integrity, as assessed by suction blister time

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skin integrity, as assessed by time to re-blistering
secondary_outcome.description: Change in skin integrity, as assessed by time to re-blistering

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in itch severity, as assessed by modified Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) itch domains
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of itch, as assessed by modified Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) itch domains, maximum score of 5 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the impact of itch on quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the impact of itch on quality of life, as assessed by the Pruritus-Specific Quality of Life Instrument (ItchyQoL), maximum score of 110 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain severity, as assessed by modified Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) pain domains
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain severity, as assessed by Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System (PROMIS) pain domains, maximum score of 5 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain severity, as assessed by the Instrument for Scoring Clinical Outcomes for Research of Epidermolysis Bullosa (iscorEB)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain severity, as assessed by the Instrument for Scoring Clinical, maximum score of 234 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of dysphagia, as assessed using the Brief Esophageal Dysphagia Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change of dysphagia, as assessed using the Brief Esophageal Dysphagia Questionnaire, maximum score is 40 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stabilization of dysphagia, as assessed using the Brief Esophageal Dysphagia Instrument
secondary_outcome.description: Stabilization of dysphagia, as assessed using the Brief Esophageal Dysphagia Instrument, maximum score of 40 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in corneal symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Change of corneal symptoms (eye symptoms), as assessed by the Epidermolysis Bullosa Eye Disease Index (EB-EDI), maximum score of 100 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stabilization of corneal symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Stabilization of corneal symptoms (eye symptoms), as assessed by the Epidermolysis Bullosa Eye Disease Index (EB-EDI), maximum score of 100 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in nutritional markers (hemoglobin)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nutritional markers, as assessed by hemoglobin

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in nutritional markers (hematocrit)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nutritional markers, as assessed by hematocrit

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in nutritional markers (total protein/albumin)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nutritional markers, as assessed by total protein/albumin

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in nutritional markers (Fe/TIBC)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nutritional markers, as assessed by total Fe/TIBC

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in nutritional markers (C-reactive protein)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of nutritional markers, as assessed by total C-reactive protein

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Investigator Global Impressions of Change (IGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Global impressions of change, as assessed through IGIC (1-7), 7 being worst

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Investigator Patient Impressions of Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Global impressions of change, as assessed through PGIC (1-7), 7 being worst

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in overall quality of life, as assessed by the Quality of Life in Epidermolysis Bullosa (QOLEB) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change in overall quality of life, as assessed by the Quality of Life in Epidermolysis Bullosa (QOLEB) questionnaire maximum score is 67 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in overall health
secondary_outcome.description: Change in overall disability, as assessed by the Health Assessment Questionnaire or Children's Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ/CHAQ) maximum score is 3 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mental health
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mental health, as assessed by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) mental health domains, maximum score is 5 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in social function
secondary_outcome.description: Change in social functioning, as assessed by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) social function domains, maximum score is 4 (worst)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in amount of wound care
secondary_outcome.description: Change in amount of wound care, as assessed by patient interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time for wound care
secondary_outcome.description: Change in time for wound care, as assessed by patient interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cost of wound care
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cost of wound care, as assessed by patient interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in overall patient impression of quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Change in overall anecdotal quality of life, as assessed by one-on-one patient interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in overall patient impression of disability
secondary_outcome.description: Change in overall anecdotal disability, as assessed by one-on-one patient interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) on pharmacokinetics parameter Cmax
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate ADA with Cmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) on pharmacokinetics parameter Tmax
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate ADA with Tmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) on pharmacokinetics parameter Area Under the Curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate ADA with Area Under the Curve (AUC)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) on pharmacokinetics parameter of clearance of PTR-01
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate ADA with clearance of PTR-01

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) on pharmacokinetics parameter of PTR-01 half-life
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate ADA with PTR-01 half-life

arm_group.description: All patients will receive a PTR-01 dose of 3.0 mg/kg once weekly every week for a total of 4 doses, followed by a dose of 3.0 mg/kg once monthly for a total of 5 doses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Willing to provide informed consent form, or if 12 to <18 years of age, legal guardian has provided informed consent form and the minor has signed an assent form acknowledging that they understand and agree to study procedures.
2. Has satisfactorily completed participation in PTR-01-002.
3. Agrees to use contraception as follows:
- For women of childbearing potential (WOCBP) agrees to use highly effective contraceptive (including abstinence) methods from Screening, through the study, and for at least 10 weeks after the last dose of study drug. Non-childbearing potential is defined as a female who meets either of the following criteria: age ≥50 years and no menses for at least 1 year or documented hysterectomy, bilateral tubal ligation, or bilateral oophorectomy.
- For males, agrees to use a condom with any WOCBP sexual partner from Day 1 of study treatment, through the study, and at least 10 weeks after the last dose of study drug.
4. Be willing and able to comply with this protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has known systemic hypersensitivity to any of the inactive ingredients in PTR-01.
2. Has previously had an anaphylactic reaction to PTR-01.
3. Is pregnant or nursing.
4. Has received in the last six months any investigational gene therapy product or in the last three months any non-gene therapy investigational products (other than PTR-01).
5. Is anticipated to receive new regimens of antibiotics or other anti-infectives during the trial.
6. Has any other medical or personal condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, may potentially compromise the safety or compliance of the
